name: Pepper Vodka
headline: Pepper Vodka
keywords: American,Vodka Recipes,Cocktail Party,Recipes for Parties,Recipes for a Crowd,Gluten Free,Low-Fat,Low Sodium

recipeInstructions.text: Add the peppercorns to the vodka and allow to sit in a cool dark place for 7 days. Stir or gently shake to combine every few days. After 7 days, strain through a fine mesh strainer to remove the peppercorns. Place in a sterilized* glass container with a lid and store in a cool dark place.
Tips on Sterilizing Jars Properly-handled sterilized equipment will keep canned foods in good condition for years. Sterilizing jars is the first step of preserving foods.

Sterilizing Tips: Jars should be made from glass and free of any chips or cracks. Preserving or canning jars are topped with a glass, plastic, or metal lid, which has a rubber seal. Two piece lids are best for canning, as they vacuum seal when processed. To sterilize jars, before filling with jams, pickles, or preserves, wash jars and lids with hot, soapy water. Rinse well and arrange jars and lids open sides up, without touching, on a tray. Boil the jars and lids in a large saucepan, covered with water, for 15 minutes. Use tongs when handling the hot sterilized jars, to move them from boiling water. Be sure the tongs are sterilized too, by dipping the ends in boiling water for a few minutes. As a rule, hot preserves go into hot jars and cold preserves go into cold jars. All items used in the process of making jams, jellies, and preserves must be clean. This includes any towels used, and especially your hands. After the jars are sterilized, you can preserve the food. It is important to follow any canning and processing instructions included in the recipe and refer to USDA guidelines about the sterilization of canned products.

review.reviewBody:
I've made this and it is SPI-DIDDLY-ICY!! But, SO GOOD!! It's like the essence of black pepper in vodka form. You can make an amazing Bloody Mary with this, plus AB's tomato-infused vodka, and just use tomato juice or V8. Extra spice not required, though not unwelcome either... ;)

Bottom line: make yourself this incredible infused vodka! It's super easy, and the results are well worth the week's wait!
Made this for fathers day and my dad LOVED IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 100 percent recommened
Alton must love pepper. I certainly do; however, the next time I make this I'll use less than half the pepper recommended.

This is so simple and the outcome has been stellar! Used to make Bloody Marys the intensity of the pepper flavor really pops through the tomato juice with a spicy flash that will have you saying "WOW" after every sip! Thank you AB for sharing!

...I used coffee!

I took a little more then 2 tablespoons lightly ground (a few pulses of my grinder) coffee beans and followed the same recipe and it is absolutely delicious!
